pullRequest.title: [KAFKA-10722] doc: Improve JavaDoc for KGroupedStream.aggregate and other similar methods
pullRequest.bodyText:
Tell that the store used internally is always a timestamped one.
This is related to KAFKA-10722.
No tests are necessary because only JavaDoc was changed.
Committer Checklist (excluded from commit message)

 Verify design and implementation
 Verify test coverage and CI build status
 Verify documentation (including upgrade notes)

commit.message:
doc: Improve JavaDoc for aggregate

Tell that the store used internally is always a timestamped one.

nodes.bodyText:
Should apply the same improvement to reduce() and count() overloads? Also for CogroupedKStream#aggregate()?
What about TimeWindowedKStream and TimeWindowedCogroupedKStream ?
Also StreamsBuilder#table() (and #globalTable()) might need an update?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -381,7 +381,8 @@ * {@link StreamsConfig#COMMIT_INTERVAL_MS_CONFIG commit intervall}. * *

- * For failure and recovery the store will be backed by an internal changelog topic that will be created in Kafka. + * For failure and recovery the store (which always will be of type {@link TimestampedKeyValueStore}) will be backed by + * an internal changelog topic that will be created in Kafka.

nodes.bodyText: {@materialized} is not valid markup as far as I know. Should we {@code materialized}? (same below)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -438,7 +439,8 @@ * query the value of the key on a parallel running instance of your Kafka Streams application. * *

- * For failure and recovery the store will be backed by an internal changelog topic that will be created in Kafka. + * For failure and recovery the store (which always will be of type {@link TimestampedKeyValueStore} -- regardless of what + * is specified in the parameter {@materialized}) will be backed by an internal changelog topic that will be created in Kafka.

nodes.bodyText:
For time-windows, it would be a TimestampedWindowStore (not tkv-store). (same below for the other method of this class)
Note the signature of Materialized<K, V, WindowStore<Bytes, byte[]>> that uses WindowStore, not KeyValueStore.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -77,7 +77,8 @@ * {@link StreamsConfig#CACHE_MAX_BYTES_BUFFERING_CONFIG cache size}, and * {@link StreamsConfig#COMMIT_INTERVAL_MS_CONFIG commit intervall}. *

- * For failure and recovery the store will be backed by an internal changelog topic that will be created in Kafka. + * For failure and recovery the store (which always will be of type {@link TimestampedKeyValueStore}) will be backed by

nodes.bodyText: As above. Should we TimestampedWindowStore for this class.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -67,7 +67,8 @@ * {@link StreamsConfig#CACHE_MAX_BYTES_BUFFERING_CONFIG cache size}, and * {@link StreamsConfig#COMMIT_INTERVAL_MS_CONFIG commit intervall}. *

- * For failure and recovery the store will be backed by an internal changelog topic that will be created in Kafka. + * For failure and recovery the store (which always will be of type {@link TimestampedKeyValueStore}) will be backed by

commit.message: doc: Fixed store type in the JavaDco comment
doc: Fixed store type in the JavaDoc comment
